result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karyssa Marie Lieffring

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Bond Report, filed by JSC. SEALED. mw    To JA/rg
Final pre-trial on December 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:39 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C Dillon via Zoom, Clerk: J Foley, Defendant Karyssa Marie Lieffring in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Karyssa Marie Lieffring.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF152, 22CF170. Atty Dolfi requests bond modification and states resolution is close. Court amends bond in 22CF170. Adjourned: 3:42 pm. jaf
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

AMENDED

- Maintain residence with parents.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J. Defoor unless authorized by probation agent.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

- Maintain employment.

08:30 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi, DF: Karyssa Marie Lieffring appeared from jail. Court reviews Atty. Dolfi's bond modification motion, DE is on PO hold until Thursday. Court questions DE regarding employment, residence once released and treatment programming. DE responds. State takes no position on bond modification. Court modifies bond. Court advises that Kara will be in contact regarding motivational group. Court resets previously scheduled PTC. Adjourned: 8:47 AM. kma  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Dolfi. km
Arraignment on March 31, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

11:46 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Benoy   ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Karyssa Marie Lieffring appeared from jail.  Atty Dolfi is requesting a dismissal.  Argument by State.  Offense date will be modified in the Information.  Court will reserve on the motion.  State calls SCCO Deputy Eric Johnson.  Witness sworn.  State direct.  Witness identifies DF.  Court questions witness.  Atty Dolfi cross.  Witness excused.  Argument.   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court questions probation status.  DF is unsure.  DF to notify Atty Dolfi when she finds out her status.  Adjourned: 12:08


  Arraignment scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 11:45 am.

01:57 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Christianson, ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius for today, DF:  Karyssa Marie Lieffring appeared from jail. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD.  Waive reading. Reserve pre-plea rights. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court notes if probation hold is lifted DE to be placed on intake calender for BBH the next following day. Court sets PH. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 11:45 am.
